meanings.definition: The act of bringing about or causing something to happen.
meanings.sent1: Her effectuation of the project impressed everyone in the team.
meanings.sent2: The effectuation of the new policy led to positive changes in the company.
meanings.sent3: His effectuation of the surprise party left everyone delighted.
meanings.sent4: The effectuation of the rescue mission was like a well-coordinated dance.
meanings.sent5: The effectuation of the plan was as smooth as silk.

meanings.definition: The process of implementing or carrying out a plan or action.
meanings.sent1: The effectuation of the strategy required careful planning.
meanings.sent2: Without proper effectuation, the project would not have succeeded.
meanings.sent3: The effectuation of the play was like watching a skilled craftsman at work.
meanings.sent4: Her effectuation of the event was a masterpiece of organization.
meanings.sent5: The effectuation of the task was swift and efficient.
